report_title: Power Circuit Breaker Manufacturing Industry Report
executive_summary: The Power Circuit Breaker Manufacturing industry has experienced fluctuations over the five years to 2021 due to volatile input costs, high import penetration and inconsistent downstream demand. Government-mandated business closures amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic significantly impaired activity within some of the industry's key markets, such as industrial production and nonresidential construction, resulting in a significantly decline in demand. Moreover, there has been continued pressure from competitively priced imports into the domestic market, ultimately constraining industry performance. Intense import competition, coupled with unfavorable economic conditions due to the coronavirus pandemic has caused an unstable environment for industry operators. As a result of these trends, industry revenue is anticipated to decline at an annualized rate of 4.5% to $2.6 billion over the five years to 2021.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industry revenue is anticipated to decline at an annualized rate of 4.5% to $2.6 billion during the five-year period due to fluctuating downstream demand and COVID-19 complications.
Industry revenue is anticipated to rise 2.3% in 2021 alone due to the widespread distribution of the coronavirus vaccine and growth in downstream markets like construction.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Industry revenue is expected to increase at an annualized rate of 2.0% to reach $2.9 billion over the five years to 2026 due to growth in downstream markets and declining input prices.
The number of industry establishments is expected to increase at an annualized rate of 4.1% to 87 locations and employment is expected to rise 2.6% to 8,109 workers over the next five years.
The average industry profit margin is expected to increase from 5.8% in 2021 to 6.3% in 2026 due to declining input prices.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures power circuit breakers that protect electrical circuits from anomalies in power supply, including overflooding or short circuiting. Various kinds of circuit breakers provide differing dimensions, depending on the user's need. Industry products are widely used by customers ranging from corporate enterprises to households.
key_trends: International trade has played a key role in determining the industry's trajectory
Emerging countries are improving their production capabilities and pose a growing threat to industry operators
The rising price of key inputs has constrained industry profitability
Increased import competition is expected to continue to siphon away revenue from industry operators
Power infrastructure spending is projected to grow
An expected rebound in profit and continued necessity of industry products are anticipated to be catalysts for industry expansion
The industry has contended with rising prices of key inputs, which are estimated to have impaired industry profitability

market_segmentation.segment_description: Power circuit breakers are vital components to the construction and maintaining of commercial buildings, hospitals, factories, power plants, mining shafts, communication lines and other nonresidential structures.

Industrial products are heavily used in the manufacturing sector, as heavy-duty electronic equipment requires the use of power circuit breakers. Efficient power circuit breakers are also used to maintain proper flow of electrical currents, which is vital to control overloads.
According to the World Bank, the United States is the third-largest high-technology exporter.
There are a variety of other applications for circuit breakers in an electricity-dependent world, including transportation, data centers and other infrastructure.

Due to their line of work, utility companies must be equipped with top-notch circuit breakers. Circuit breakers can monitor multiple electrical currents at one time, making them excellent tools for a variety of infrastructure-related projects.
Industry products are required to power both residential homes and apartment buildings, including all the lighting and appliances.

products_and_services.product_description: Molded case circuit breakers (MCCB) use electromechanical trip units that provide protection by combining a current sensitive electromagnetic device with a temperature-sensitive device.
Other low-voltage circuit breakers include miniature circuit breakers (MCB).
Medium-voltage circuit breakers can be used outdoors in a substation or indoors assembled into metal-enclosed switchgear line ups.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand from downstream markets affects industry operators.
The industry is affected by changes in the value of the US dollar.
Changes in per capita disposable income affect demand.
The industrial sector is a major user of electricity.
The construction sector is also a primary market for industry products.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The Power Circuit Breaker Manufacturing industry has seen an increasing portion of domestic demand, reaching 43.4% in 2021.
Despite the high level of import competition, the industry is expected to experience relief due to a reduction in the trade-weighted index.
Volatile trade relations have caused a contraction in international trade with China.

business_locations.location_description: A region with a diverse demographic.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Environmental Protection Agency sets standards for materials used and emissions levels.
OSHA has guidelines to protect workers manufacturing electrical equipment.
Regulations were implemented to discourage unsafe work environments.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Access to the latest technology can be costly.
Access to skilled employees can be scarce.
Establishing a reputation in the market.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies primarily compete on product quality.
Companies primarily compete on the variety of products offered.
Price is a lesser form of competition.

concentration_points.concentration_description: In 2021, the three largest companies account for 27.9% of revenue.
Concentration has increased over the past five years.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The rising prices of key inputs have constrained industry profit.
Low-cost imports have placed downward pressure on prices.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: For every $1.00 spent on wages, $0.09 is spent on capital.
Capital expenditures remain steady due to long product life.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Industry dependent on downstream demand from sectors.
Changes and competition have a major effect.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Technological innovations make operations more efficient.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Rising imports compete with our products on a cost basis due to their low wage costs.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: We are able to specialize in a niche to better serve our specific customers.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Input prices for metals such as copper have fluctuated.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations?
FAQs.answer: By investing in new, efficient technology we curb emissions.
